Pre-Game Insights: England aim to make it three for three under the wing of Lee Carsley
Greece seek their 14th win of the tournament to move three points clear of their rivals
Carsley will be under no illusions that anything other than first place would be a massive black mark next to his name
Greece have demonstrated their League A credentials with comfortable beatings of Finland (3-0) and Ireland (2-0) in their opening two battles
Post-Match Reflections: England's caretaker manager Lee Carsley is doing his chances of taking the reins full-time no harm whatsoever
Greece's new management, led by Ivan Jovanovic, endeavours to end Greece's 12-match winless run against top-five ranked nations
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's record goalscorer Kane has been given the green light to turn out for his country after an injury scare
Greece's attacking burden should fall onto the shoulders of Vangelis Pavlidis, who scored 80 goals in three seasons with AZ Alkmaar
Greece's new goalkeeper Odysseas Vlachodimos is set to win his 45th cap in goal for the Pirate Ship this week
Others: England's predicted starting lineup includes Pickford, Alexander-Arnold, Stones, Colwill, Lewis, Rice, Bellingham, Saka, Palmer, Foden, and Watkins
Greece's predicted starting lineup includes Vlachodimos, Rota, Mavropanos, Koulierakis, Tsimikas, Siopis, Kourbelis, Masouras, Bakasetas, Tzolis, and Pavlidis
